sect1.title: Fuse-&fuse3-version;

sect2.title: Kernel Configuration
sect2.para: Enable the following options in the kernel configuration and recompile the kernel if necessary:

screen.literal: File systems ---> <*/M> FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace) support [CONFIG_FUSE_FS]

sect2.title: Installation of Fuse
sect2.para: Install Fuse by running the following commands:

screen.userinput:
sed -i '/^udev/,$ s/^/#/' util/meson.build &&
mkdir build && cd build &&
meson --prefix=/usr .. && ninja

sect2.para: The API documentation is included in the package, but if you have installed and wish to rebuild it, issue doxygen doc/Doxyfile.
This package does not come with a test suite.

screen.userinput:
ninja install &&
mv -vf /usr/lib/libfuse3.so.3* /lib && ln -sfvn ../../lib/libfuse3.so.3.2.0 /usr/lib/libfuse3.so &&
mv -vf /usr/bin/fusermount3 /bin && mv -vf /usr/sbin/mount.fuse3 /sbin &&
install -v -m755 -d /usr/share/doc/fuse-&fuse3-version; && install -v -m644 ../doc/{README.NFS,kernel.txt} \ /usr/share/doc/fuse-&fuse3-version; && cp -Rv ../doc/html /usr/share/doc/fuse-&fuse3-version; &&
gunzip /usr/share/man/{man1/fusermount3.1,man8/mount.fuse.8}.gz

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: sed ... util/meson.build: This command disables the installation of a boot script and udev rule that are not needed.
mv ... libfuse3.so.3*; ln ... libfuse3.so: These commands install the libraries in the /lib directory.
unzip ...: This uncompresses the installed man pages to be consistent with the rest of the man pages.

sect3.title: Config Files
sect3.para: Some options regarding mount policy can be set in the file /etc/fuse.conf. To install the file run the following command as the root user:

screen.userinput:
cat > /etc/fuse.conf << "EOF" # Set the maximum number of FUSE mounts allowed to non-root users. # The default is 1000. # #mount_max = 1000
# Allow non-root users to specify the 'allow_other' or 'allow_root' # mount options. # #user_allow_other EOF

sect3.para: Additional information about the meaning of the configuration options are found in the man page.
